posts.title: Moody's downgrades JPM, BofA and Wells Fargo after US credit rating cut
top_comments: When Moody's finally starts downgrading private equity firms and their bundled garbage, then you'll know the music is about to stop. They have to give time for the people up top to get a chair
Well that’s another +500 for the DOW!
I’ve said it here before and I’ll say it again. After the Wells Fargo creating unwanted accounts for the customers years ago, I still can’t wrap my head around anyone trusting them with their money.
Trump bailouts are incoming. Dont worry, Republicans will blame Democrats for inflation after they spend like maniacs to clean up their reckless policy.
Surprised trump hasn’t called moodys a socialist, Marxist, anti-Christian, anti-American organization

And here goes the domino of sovereign credit rating to corporates. The end of it are rate hikes and defaults for the consumers recalled credits and collapsing leverage structures. 

This is going to be bad. Americans think tariffs are a problem? This can snowball in months into sovereign default.
100% self inflicted and optional, thanks to one person: Trump.
Moody is starting to really have some balls on them.
All three heavily contributed to Trump and the GOP. Leopards meet faces.
Does this actually affect people?

posts.title: Passenger jet aborted takeoff to avoid LaGuardia runway collision
top_comments:
Federal officials are investigating why two planes got dangerously close on a runway at New York's LaGuardia Airport earlier this month despite the airport being equipped with an advanced surface radar system that's designed to help prevent such close calls.

Both the Federal Aviation Administration and the National Transportation Safety Board said Monday that they are investigating the May 6 incident when a Republic Airways jet had to abort takeoff and slam to a stop because a United Airlines plane was still taxiing across the runway.

**In audio from the tower that ABC obtained from the website** [**www.LiveATC.net**](https://www.liveatc.net/)**, the air traffic control said to the pilot of the Republic Airways jet: “Sorry, I thought United had cleared well before that.”...**

I am a stupid person. 

Are these kinds of instances actually occurring more often as a result of the actions of this current administration? Or, has it been “status quo”, i.e., these things happen on a “consistent basis” and we are just receiving a hell of a lot more press on it now?

Again, I am a stupid person. Thank you for patience.
Those DOGE cuts and layoffs are really saving a lot of money. What could possibly go wrong.
Are we just seeing more news of near collisions and accidents or are the incidents actually up since the cuts?

This administration is an embarrassment. 
I feel like it's gonna take a bit of luck to survive it.
Cool.   Looking forward to flying out of LGA tomorrow.
Ship travel making a comeback baby!

something something Biden's prostate, Obama's tan suit,  George Soros. 

/s
How many days without a crash?
It always surprised me that LaGuardia wasn’t the NYC airport completely melting down. I have never had a positive experience flying in or out of that airport

posts.title: DOJ says it has charged N.J. congresswoman with assaulting law enforcement at ICE facility
top_comments: [But have also dropped the charges against Newark mayor](https://www.cbsnews.com/newyork/news/ras-baraka-charge-dropped-alina-habba/)

Funny how there are media reports from a couple of days ago that they’re changing how they’re charging public officials (https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/5307294-doj-key-review-elected-officials-prosecutions/amp/). 

Also funny how they made a big deal of not weaponizing the DOJ; only to blatantly weaponize it.

>Acting U.S. Attorney for the District of New Jersey Alina Habba made the announcement on X, where she accused the Democratic lawmaker of “assaulting, impeding and interfering with law enforcement.”

This is what they're going to do to anyone and everyone who stands in ICE's way.
[removed]
This regime is destroying the 97% conviction rate of the DOJ
Fascists are trying to instill fear into the opposition. Never back down. This is a slam dunk case for her.
The visit to the ICE facility was an official act as part of her legislative oversight authority. She has legislative immunity. Supreme Court said so.
Fox is analyzing the video of this “assault” this like it’s the Zapruder film. Such bullshit. Know who was really assaulted ? The Capital Police on January 6.
Assaulted by LEO? Charged with assaulting LEO.
Didn't Marjorie Greene Taylor kick a person and not get charged?

posts.title: Netflix strikes deal to bring Sesame Street to streaming giant
top_comments: Joking aside, I like that this gives them some financial stability while still allowing the episodes to air on PBS. If that side of it eventually stops, however, it would be terrible to put something as beneficial as Sesame Street behind a paywall.
Sounds good. They get continue to on PBS with same day release on Netflix
A is for Are You Still Watching
So it'll get cancelled in a couple seasons after getting rave reviews?
Elmo doing a sketch as Eleven from Stranger Things is definitely something I'd watch.
Jim Henson is rolling in his grave over the private takeover of a public learning experience for children
Cookie Monster needs to do the Netflix dun dunnnn.

What I really would have liked, is if Netflix made all the Sesame Street shows available without a subscription and made it ad free. But I understand their company, at least PBS has some alternative funding
P is for Pay your fucking subscription fees

Am I the only one that thinks this is kind of gross?  Another public asset gobbled up by a faceless corporation to be bent to their will?  Suddenly Elmo will have politics that just so happen to align with Netflix’s board.

posts.title: UK pauses trade deal talks with Israel, summons ambassador over
top_comments: "Never again" is only for them.

The title of the article is “UK pauses trade deal talks with Israel, summons ambassador over new Gaza offensive”. 

This sort of diplomatic pressure is the sort of thing Israel will now have to take into account when denying basic needs to millions of people in Gaza.

There is no attainable war goal for Israel so all is left is the death and destruction of Gaza. Hamas releasing the hostages won't end the war (nor does it seem a priority for the Israeli government) and there will never be a full Hamas surrender. In fact with 40,000+ civilians killed they've likely  created more militants that hate Israel than they had before the war began. You don't create peace through death and destruction of civilian populations.

Israel need to create a better alternative to Hamas, because currently it's a choice between the terrorists of Hamas or the people killing your family and friends and a lot of them are going to pick the first option if no reasonable alternative exists. Something the current Israeli government can not provide and something they do not want to provide.
If what the U.N. said is even half true - that 14,000 babies are going to die from starvation in the next two days, its time for direct, very firm pressure on Netanyahu,
While simultaneously arguing with their courts that they should still be allowed to sell weapons to Israel to be used in their genocide. Amazing dichotomy there.

Good. It's about time it was recognised that it's not anti semitic to call Israel out on all the horrible shit they've done. Just because hamas is evil doesn't give them carte blanche to do what they like.

With this and the trade deals it's nice to have a government who gets stuff done for once.
About damn time, absolutely the worst scum this planet has to offer. They don't even have second thoughts about murdering 10s of thousands of children.
Good stuff.
Good!

posts.title: Supplier to major supermarkets hit by cyber attack
top_comments:
I've worked at food distribution sites and its it is laughable. it works and it's generally efficient... but fully open to attacks from internal and external sources.

computers with no password, using unlocked excel spreadsheets, just being able to wander around the back of the building and walk through a door, thousands of agency staff with potential access...

it doesn't really surprise me that something like this can happen, and it could probably happen in most warehouses
I guess hackers don't want grocery stores to stay stocked? As if grocery stores aren't gonna suffer enough this year and so on.
[removed]

posts.title: Sheriff’s office staffer arrested in connection with New Orleans jailbreak
top_comments:
>The inmates escaped through a hole in a wall behind a toilet in the early hours of Friday while the lone guard watching them went to get food.

It *is* toward the end of crawfish season. 

>Since the escape, Hutson has pointed to long-standing deficiencies such as faulty locks and staffing shortages. But a growing number of state and local officials have said blame for the escape rests squarely on her for failing her responsibility to keep inmates locked up.

There's always this finger-pointing. Louisiana is notorious for overstaffing police and DAs offices, while understaffing prisons and public defender offices. I'm going to say there are staff shortages that were ignored. [They'll still blame her.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Susan_Hutson) BTW, Sheriffs are elected positions in Louisiana.
I watched the series on Netflix about  the prison breakout in upstate New York just a little while ago. This seems weirdly similar. Did they watch it too?

Perfect example of why you should never talk to LEO without a lawyer.   Like, who knew just doing something that sounds like an innocuous thing would lead to a prison escape and a whole host of serious charges.
Why the fuck are comments disappearing
Were they too stupid to know that everyone was going to see that this was an inside job?
